benchmark_details.name: Neptune
benchmark_details.overview: Neptune is a benchmark for long video understanding requiring reasoning over long time horizons and across different modalities. It covers a broad range of long video reasoning abilities, including dense, time-aligned video captions and challenging question-answer-decoy sets for video segments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To spur the development of more advanced models capable of understanding long videos and to provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for video question answering tasks.

data.source: Automated YouTube video selection and processing pipeline

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on matching candidate answers to reference answers, with evaluations derived from human-annotated equivalence.
methodology.interpretation: Good performance is indicated by the ability to closely match human judgment on answer equivalence; underperformance shows a significant gap in understanding long videos.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance comparisons made against state-of-the-art models such as Gemini-1.5-pro and Video-LLaMA2
methodology.validation: Tested against a variety of state-of-the-art video understanding models including both open-source and proprietary systems.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset leverages publicly available videos under the assumption of consent for academic use.
